name: Richard Höchenberger
body:
## About Me My main professional interests are in the fundamental and temporal aspects of multisensory perception. I am currently working on my PhD in the laboratory of [Dr Kathrin Ohla](http://www.kathrinohla.net/) at the [German Institute of Human Nutrition](http://dife.de), where my principal focus is on interaction between the chemical and non-chemical senses. Aside from neuroscience, I am very much interested in progressive social movements; urban planning and city development and its social implications; security in general and IT security in particular; and different types of endurance sports. ## Skills & Techniques * **Programming & Analytics:** Python, R (including ggplot), Matlab, and Common Lisp on GNU/Linux, Mac OS X, and Windows * **Typesetting:** LaTeX & LyX * **Psychophysics:** PsychoPy, Psychtoolbox * **EEG:** BrainVision Recorder & PyCorder, EEGLAB * **Hardware & Electronics:** National Instruments data-acquisition boards for experimental control, custom design of stimulation and measurement hardware and corresponding software interfaces for psychophysical testing ## Publications My **ORCID** is [0000-0002-0380-4798](http://orcid.org/0000-0002-0380-4798); my **ResearcherID** is [I-8360-2015](https://www.researcherid.com/rid/I-8360-2015). My publications are also listed on my **[Google Scholar profile](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=CJg7pA4AAAAJ)**. ### Articles * **R Höchenberger**, NA Busch, K Ohla (in revision): Nonlinear response speedup in bimodal visual-olfactory object identification. _Frontiers in Psychology_. ### Talks, Presentations & Posters * **R Höchenberger,** NA Busch, K Ohla (2015): The race for food: Response facilitation in visual-olfactory stimulation. Poster presented at the International Multisensory Research Forum (IMRF) in Pisa, Italy. (Poster) * **R Höchenberger,** NA Busch, K Ohla (2015): Response facilitation in visual-olfactory stimulation. Poster presented at Tagung experimentell arbeitender Psychologen (TeaP) in Hildesheim, Germany. (Poster) * **R Höchenberger,** NA Busch, K Ohla (2014): Response time speedup in visual-olfactory stimulation suggests multisensory facilitation. Poster presented at the International Multisensory Research Forum (IMRF) in Amsterdam, Netherlands. (Poster) * LT Boenke, **R Höchenberger,** A Zeghbib, D Alais, FW Ohl (2013): [Interaction of spatial and temporal processing in the context of audio-visual synchrony judgment and temporal-order judgment.](http://www.perceptionweb.com/abstract.cgi?id=v130807) _Perception_ 42, ECVP Abstract Supplement, 171. (Conference Talk) * LT Boenke, **R Höchenberger,** FW Ohl, D Alais (2011): [Temporal aspects of sound induced visual fission and fusion in the double-flash illusion paradigm.](http://i-perception.perceptionweb.com/journal/I/article/ic832) _i-Perception_ 2(8), 832-832. (Poster) ## Education * **Mar 2013–present:** Ongoing work on my PhD in medical science. German Institute of Human Nutrition, Nuthetal, Germany & Charité University Medicine Berlin, Germany. Supvervision: Dr Kathrin Ohla & Prof Dr Niko A Busch * **Oct 2005–Jun 2013:** Diploma (MSc) in Biosystems Engineering. Thesis: _Perceiving the temporal order of events without perceiving their succession: A cross-modal study in humans using the McGurk effect._ Otto-von-Guericke-Universität, Magdeburg, Germany. Supervison: Lars T Boenke & Prof Dr Frank W Ohl ## Research Experience * **Dec 2011–Apr 2012:** Research stay at Prof Dr David Alais' vision lab Research topic: _Investigation of cross-modal interaction in humans by utilizing the McGurk illusion_. University of Sydney, NSW, Australia. Supervision: Lars T Boenke, Prof Dr David Alais * **Nov 2010–Nov 2011:** Student research project. Topic: _Temporal aspects of sound-induced fission and fusion in the double-flash illusion paradigm._ Otto-von-Guericke-Universität, Magdeburg, Germany & Leibniz Institute for Neurobiology, Magdeburg, Germany. Supervison: Lars T Boenke * **Jun 2009–Mar 2013:** Research assistant of Lars T Boenke (audio-visual temporal order/synchrony judgment, EEG). Leibniz Institute for Neurobiology, Magdeburg, Germany. * **Nov 2006–Dec 2008:** Research assistant in FORSYS systems biology program. Institute of Mathematical Optimization, Otto-von-Guericke-Universität, Magdeburg, Germany. Supervision: Dr Utz-Uwe Haus ## Stipends & Grants * **2011:** EU-funded ([TIMELY](http://www.timely-cost.eu/)) participation in the _Time and the Conscious Brain_ workshop, Delmenhorst, Germany. ## Connect * [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RHoechenberger) * [Facebook](https://facebook.com/hoechenberger) * [Google+](https://plus.google.com/+RichardHöchenberger) * [ResearchGate](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Richard_Hoechenberger) * [Academia.edu](https://dife.academia.edu/RichardH%C3%B6chenberger) * [LinkedIn](https://de.linkedin.com/in/hoechenberger) * [Loop](http://loop.frontiersin.org/people/228736/) * [GitHub](https://github.com/hoechenberger) German Institute of Human Nutrition
– Psychophysiology of Food Perception –
Arthur-Scheunert-Allee 114–116
14558 Nuthetal
Germany Phone: +49 33 200 88 2427 Email: `richard.hoechenberger@dife.de`.
For encrypted email communication, you may use [my PGP key](../files/hoechenberger.asc) with the fingerprint `54D7 E550 653C FD18 7F48 A87B 7F19 9F9F FAFD 87ED`. ## Social Responsibility I'm a supporter of [Pro Asyl](http://www.proasyl.de/en/), an association dedicated to the preservation, defense, and enforcement of fundamental human rights of refugees in Germany and Europe.
